reviews.review_msg: Professor Sadri is a great prof! Super helpful and always willing to answer questions. The course material is clear and straightforward, and the assignments are actually useful since the bonus marks from them help you beat the curve. Definitely recommend taking his class!
Easy to follow professor with a caring attitude

His lectures were clear and concise.  He is a great lecturer and is always willing to help.  His exams are EASY.  If you do all of the assignments that he posts for FREE MARKS!!  And review the answers that he releases to you, there is absolutely no issue with his exams.  He is a very fair professor.  Would recommend taking his class.

I don't think he was too bad of a professor. I feel like his tests definitely reflected what was taught, the hw plus practice questions that were assigned. The class itself is obviously difficult due to the concepts. I mostly did self studying and never showed up to class. Make sure you know all the main concepts!

He is not as bad as people say he is, his lectures are a dry but you don't really need to go anyway. Just read the lecture notes and teach yourself the material, it isn't too hard. Exams make up 100% of the grade and are somewhat difficult (lots of "trick" questions)
Brutal prof all exams in this class no chances to get any extra credit through assignments also makes the final much harder than the midterms, assigns practice questions that he never goes over them.

Mohamed Sadri is a kind soul and good professor. He genuinely cares about his students and wants them to succeed. He values when students put in effort and gives you chances to improve your grade with the optional weekly M assignments. If you study and put in effort, you will succeed in this class.
No problem in this class, he explained concepts well enough, tests were fair as long as u did the homework and watched the lectures, exams didn't try to surprise you.

Mohamad is passionate about teaching and he's a kind man. Although he isn't always amazing at explaining concepts, if you study a lot I think you'll be okay. His tests weren't the easiest but I think they were fair and the TA marked fairly as well. He also focuses more on course concepts and terms over equations so it works if you're bad at math.

This professor genuinely cares about his students' success. If you focus on studying the lecture notes and completing the 'M' assignmentsâ€”which offer an extra 1% boost to your grade you can do really well in the class. While some students have left negative reviews about his exams, I personally found them fair and not as challenging.

Dr. Sadri is an amazing teacher. He explains concepts very well and genuinely enjoys helping students. The course material is hard but he provides relevant homework to understand the concepts. His lectures and assignment dates are very organized. Practice the homework questions and you will do good in 207.

Lectures and explanations are very unclear and the slides are not helpful at all. He doesn't do a good job of explaining even simple concepts. He also comes off like he doesn't care about the students and is too good to give effort to answer your questions. Grading is based 100% on exams. Be prepared to learn everything yourself if you take him.

Midterm and Finals are worth all the marks. The exams only consist of 10 questions, so if you get one wrong thats like 20 marks gone right there. He puts very specific things from the slides and puts it on the exam so study the slides. The long answer questions are pretty straight forward just practice the questions.
